intro: Papeda rumphii, commonly known as the Java apple or rumphii apple, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. The fruit contains a single seed enclosed in a fleshy, edible pulp. It is often grown for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
